pr_title: Use File.list and File.walk within a try with resource

timeline.message:
Use File.list and File.walk within a try with resource

The API contract of File.list and File.walk requires them to be closed after use.

Fix from review

Left out filter

Fix from review

Factored out deleteFile with better debug

timeline.bodyText: Bzzzt. Do not pass go, do not collect $100. YOu can only delete it if it has expired!
timeline.author: janbartel

timeline.bodyText: So the debug output looking like the delete happened will be done even if the file wasn't actually deleted.
timeline.author: janbartel

replies.bodyText: factored out to a better common deleteFile method
replies.author: gregw

timeline.bodyText: In general, I'm not sure we need to do the delete outside of the stream: there are plenty of examples if you do a google search where the recommended way to do a recursive directory delete is to use Files.walk/list and delete each file. I can't find any counter examples that says that is a bad idea.
timeline.author: janbartel

timeline.bodyText: This delete is still in here: if the intention is to avoid doing deletes inside the stream, you'll need to completely rework this code.
timeline.author: janbartel

replies.bodyText: oops - no worries, I have switched back to single walk anyway.
